prompt:
I have the following gene expression data, "leukemiaExp.txt". The file is tab separated. The table has gene names on the first column. Each row is a gene and each column is a distinct sample. Filter genes based on their variability so we retain the most variable top 1000 genes. Based on these variable genes, plot a heatmap with clustering. Also plot PCA for samples.

response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(gplots)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(pheatmap)
library(ggplot2)

# Read the gene expression data
data <- read.delim("leukemiaExp.txt", sep = "\t")

# Remove the gene names column
expr_data <- data[, -1]

# Calculate the variance of each gene
variances <- apply(expr_data, 1, var)

# Sort the genes based on their variance in descending order
sorted_genes <- order(variances, decreasing = TRUE)

# Select the top 1000 most variable genes
top_genes <- sorted_genes[1:1000]

# Subset the expression data to retain only the top variable genes
filtered_data <- expr_data[top_genes, ]

# Perform clustering and create a heatmap
heatmap_data <- t(filtered_data)
heatmap_colors <- colorRampPalette(brewer.pal(9, "Blues"))(50)
pheatmap(heatmap_data, cluster_rows = TRUE, cluster_cols = TRUE, col = heatmap_colors)

# Perform PCA and create a plot
pca_data <- prcomp(filtered_data, scale = TRUE)
pca_plot <- ggplot() + 
  geom_point(aes(x = pca_data$x[,1], y = pca_data$x[,2])) + 
  labs(x = "PC1", y = "PC2") +
  theme_minimal()
print(pca_plot)
```
